鑽井.definition: to drill (e.g. for oil); a borehole

鑽堅仰高.definition: lit. looking up to it, it gets higher; boring into it, it gets harder (idiom) (from Analects); fig. to delve deeply into one's studies; meticulous and diligent study

鑽孔.definition: to bore a hole; to drill; drilled hole

鑽心.definition: to sneak in; to infiltrate; to be piercingly painful; to be unbearable (of pain, itch etc)

鑽心蟲.definition: boring insect; snout moth's larva (Aphomia gullaris or Plodia interpuncuella or Heliothus armigera etc), major agricultural pest

鑽故紙堆.definition: to dig into piles of outdated writings (idiom); to study old books and papers

鑽木取火.definition: to drill wood to make fire

鑽桌子.definition: to crawl under a table (e.g. as a penalty for losing in a card game)

鑽洞.definition: to bore; to burrow; to crawl through a tunnel

鑽營.definition: toadying for personal gain; to curry favor; to study in great depth

鑽版.definition: to cut a woodblock (e.g. for printing)

鑽牛角.definition: lit. honing a bull's horn; fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem; to bash one's head against a brick wall; a wild goose chase; a blind alley; to split hairs; same as idiom 鑽牛角尖|钻牛角尖

鑽牛角尖.definition: lit. to penetrate into a bull's horn (idiom); fig. to waste time on an insoluble or insignificant problem; to bash one's head against a brick wall; a wild goose chase; a blind alley; to split hairs

鑽石王老五.definition: highly eligible bachelor; desirable male partner

鑽研.definition: to study meticulously; to delve into

鑽空子.definition: to take advantage of a loophole; to exploit an advantage; to seize the opportunity (esp. to do sth bad)

鑽謀.definition: to use influence to get what one wants; to find a way through (esp. corrupt); to succeed by means fair or foul

鑽進.definition: to get into; to dig into (studies, job etc); to squeeze into
